pr_title: Fix ordering of options in Jib Cli

timeline.message: add scope to target option in order to be used by subcommand
add scope for additional tags option

timeline.bodyText: Should we also move context, build-file and parameter to Build.java?
timeline.author: mpeddada1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -83,7 +85,8 @@
       required = true,
       paramLabel = "<target-image>",
       description =
-          "The destination image reference or jib style url,%nexamples:%n gcr.io/project/image,%n registry://image-ref,%n docker://image,%n tar://path")
+          "The destination image reference or jib style url,%nexamples:%n gcr.io/project/image,%n registry://image-ref,%n docker://image,%n tar://path",
+      scope = CommandLine.ScopeType.INHERIT)
   @SuppressWarnings("NullAway.Init") // initialized by picocli
   private String targetImage;

replies.bodyText: Good question. By parameters, you mean the three hidden parameters? I think they should be shared. And for context and build-file, it makes sense to move to Build.java, since we are not using them in Jar.java at the moment.
replies.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: Sounds good! Oh sorry by parameter, I meant the templating parameter.
replies.author: mpeddada1

replies.bodyText:
I don't think I'll comb through all the options. Just make sure to move options only specific to the build command (like those three) to Build.java.
BTW, the doc says that INHERIT cannot be used in @ArgGroup, which we have in some places. But I guess it's irrelevant to us?
replies.author: chanseokoh

replies.bodyText: Ah good point. Applying the INHERIT feature for the @ArgGroup  still seems to be a work in progress. Currently, using INHERIT on the options in the arg group allows those options to be inherited by all the subcommands but it doesn't let the other arg group attributes to be inherited (for example, validation for exclusivity). This might be something that we need when we are handling credentials for the jar and build subcommands. Hm it is probably better to use Mixins for now as support for INHERIT is still a little new.
replies.author: mpeddada1

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/jib-cli/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/tools/jib/cli/cli2/JibCli.java b/jib-cli/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/tools/jib/cli/cli2/JibCli.java
index f3b883dd6..d493ba236 100644
--- a/jib-cli/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/tools/jib/cli/cli2/JibCli.java
+++ b/jib-cli/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/tools/jib/cli/cli2/JibCli.java

@@ -79,17 +78,6 @@ public class JibCli {
   @SuppressWarnings("NullAway.Init") // initialized by picocli
   private boolean serialize;
 
-  // Build Configuration
-  @Option(
-      names = {"-t", "--target"},
-      required = true,
-      paramLabel = "<target-image>",
-      description =
-          "The destination image reference or jib style url,%nexamples:%n gcr.io/project/image,%n registry://image-ref,%n docker://image,%n tar://path",
-      scope = CommandLine.ScopeType.INHERIT)
-  @SuppressWarnings("NullAway.Init") // initialized by picocli
-  private String targetImage;
-
   @Option(
       names = {"-c", "--context"},
       defaultValue = ".",

timeline.message: Move all common options to separate class and create separate tests for build and jar subcommands
Move all common options to separate class and create separate tests for build and jar subcommands
